column4: hello guys.. today I cloned two hard disks with a ubuntu OS. The copy doesnt run because it boots into a grub command prompt..  what could have gone wrong?
you need to set the uuid in grub
different hdd == different uuid to boot from
you could boot into a livecd and re-install grub on the one that won't boot
it should auto-detect the drive and update it
in the live cd..i should choose repair a broken system.. ?
read: what I linked @ reinstall from livecd.  simple instructions are there
quick question.. once this is fixed... then I dont need to "fix it" every time i pop the HD on a different hardware right?
(the original copy does work on any hardware)
different hdd == different uuid to boot from
every time you change the hdd you boot from, you have to re-install grub
well, you technically don't need to re-install grub every time, you can just reconfigure it
